TITLE: Aston Martin gets a boost from Formula 1 and new high-performance models
SUMMARY: Aston Martin has overhauled manufacturing, shored up its financials and is now launching a fleet of new products defined by high performance.

TITLE: The 10 books the rich will be reading this summer
SUMMARY: The list includes books on effective communication, AI, Formula One, whiskey, hidden vacation spots and the art collection of Alicia Keys and Swizz Beatz.

TITLE: Palm Beach housekeepers are making $150,000 a year due to massive demand from the wealthy
SUMMARY: The mass wealth migration to Florida from New York and other high-tax states has created record demand for household staff in elite Florida enclaves.

TITLE: Family offices become prime targets for cyber hacks and ransomware
SUMMARY: With their large wealth and small staffs, family offices have become lucrative targets for hackers and cybercriminals, experts say.

TITLE: 'Quiet wealth' takes on new meaning with super-private deals for mansions, art and classic cars
SUMMARY: Last year, while combined public auction sales for Sotheby's, Christie's and Phillips fell by 19%, private sales rose.

TITLE: Shares of Cartier owner Richemont climb on record full-year sales, new CEO
SUMMARY: Shares of Swiss luxury group Richemont climbed as much as 6.3% Friday after it reported record full-year sales even as Asia-Pacific spending waned.

TITLE: China’s Shenzhen metropolis sees fastest growth in millionaires globally
SUMMARY: In 2023 alone, Shenzhen saw a 10% growth in millionaires, while Beijing and Shanghai recorded a decline of around 5% amid an exodus of high-net-worth individuals from China.

TITLE: 'Wealth can be pretty isolating': Problems that rich people face, according to therapists
SUMMARY: Can money buy happiness? Contrary to what some may think, a million-dollar paycheck does not necessarily come with a problem free pass.

TITLE: An art market full of cracks is about to face a $1 billion test
SUMMARY: While the spring sales typically have more than a dozen works offered for more than $30 million each, this year there are just a few.

TITLE: London's elite Garrick Club votes to allow women for the first time
SUMMARY: Members of Britain's exclusive all-male Garrick Club voted on Tuesday to permit women to join the institution for the first time in its 193-year history.

TITLE: New York tops the list of the 50 richest cities in the world
SUMMARY: The U.S. is increasing its lead as the largest creator of millionaires and billionaires in the world.

TITLE: Equinox launches $40,000 membership to help you live longer
SUMMARY: "Optimize by Equinox" is a personalized health program that includes everything from personal training and nutrition to sleep coaching and massage therapy.

TITLE: Talent war between family offices and Wall Street drives up salaries
SUMMARY: Wealthy families are spending an average of $3 million to run their family offices, according to a J.P. Morgan Private report, and the biggest cost is staffing.

TITLE: Family offices are looking beyond the stock market for higher returns, new report finds
SUMMARY: Unlike stocks, alternatives such as private equity and private companies have more gradual valuation changes, smoothing out volatility.

TITLE: The new class war: A wealth gap between millennials
SUMMARY: The surge in wealth among millennial heirs is creating new markets for wealth-management firms, luxury companies, travel firms and real estate brokers.

TITLE: Kering shares sink 9% after profit warning on declining Gucci sales
SUMMARY: Shares of French luxury group Kering sank more than 9% Wednesday after the company warned it expects a sharp downturn in first-half profits as demand for its Gucci brand continues to wane.

TITLE: Luxury real estate prices just hit an all-time record
SUMMARY: Luxury real estate sales increased more than 2%, posting their best year-over-year gains in three years, according to Redfin.

TITLE: Meet the private doctor to the wealthy — at $40,000 a year
SUMMARY: The rise of family office-style medical practices reflects the surge in wealth and growing demand for hyper-personalized, data-driven health care.

TITLE: Here's where the world's top 0.001% are putting their money, according to wealth experts
SUMMARY: There are about 28,420 centimillionaires globally, largely concentrated in New York City, the Bay Area, Los Angeles, London and Beijing.

TITLE: Superyacht sales plunge as wait times rise, Russian oligarchs drop out of the market
SUMMARY: Sales of superyachts took a dive in 2023, as long waiting lists, soaring costs and Russian oligarch sanctions hit demand.

TITLE: State tax officials are using AI to go after wealthy payers
SUMMARY: New York state is sending out AI-generated letters looking for tax revenue, many of them focused on remote work or a change in tax residency.

TITLE: The rich are getting second passports, citing risk of instability
SUMMARY: The top destinations for supplemental passports among Americans are Portugal, Malta, Greece and Italy, according to a leading law firm.

TITLE: The wealth of the 1% just hit a record $44 trillion
SUMMARY: Economists say the rising stock market is giving an added boost to consumer spending through what is known as the "wealth effect."

TITLE: Winning ticket for Mega Millions $1.128 billion jackpot sold in New Jersey — here’s how much the winner will owe in taxes
SUMMARY: A single ticket in New Jersey won the $1.128 billion Mega Millions jackpot. Here is how much the winner will owe in taxes.

TITLE: Mumbai overtakes Beijing to become Asia's billionaire capital for the first time
SUMMARY: Mumbai is now the Asian capital with the most number of billionaires, according to Hurun Research Institute's global rich list.

TITLE: An 'often overlooked' retirement savings option can lower your tax bill, advisor says. Here's how it works
SUMMARY: There's still time to lower your 2023 tax bill or boost your refund with a spousal IRA for married couples. Here's who qualifies.

TITLE: Mega Millions jackpot hits $1.1 billion — and the big winner could face these costly pitfalls
SUMMARY: The Mega Millions jackpot hit an estimated $1.1 billion, the fifth-largest prize in the game's history. The winner could face these pitfalls, experts say.

TITLE: Mark Cuban says this common leadership style is a toxic trait: 'Trust the process or fix what's broken'
SUMMARY: Don't be a micromanaging boss, advises billionaire entrepreneur Mark Cuban. Here's why it can be toxic, and what to do if your supervisor is too overbearing.

TITLE: The U.S. is the top country for millionaires and billionaires
SUMMARY: The population of millionaires in the U.S. over the past five years has grown nearly twice as fast as China’s.

TITLE: 'Quiet luxury' was once all about fashion — but now it describes how the top 1% travel too
SUMMARY: Stealth wealth is spilling into the travel industry, as the rich forgo glitzy see-and-be-seen destinations for more discreet getaways.
